page.title: 09Methodist Church,Sellindge
page.content: The Methodist Church came to Sellindge in 1883 when Mr.J.W.Andrew,a Colporteur,wished to provide the opportunity in the village for non- conformist worship.Initially meetings were held in Thomas Rigden's barn.A Mr.Coke,a local preacher,was shepherd to Mr. Rigden and the result of this relationship was the building of the Chapel,paid for by Mr. Rigden.It was built by Mr.Cambourne of Folkestone in 1883 for Â£1,264 5s 8d, including furnishings,on its present site 150 yards East of the Parish Church on the South side of the main A20 road.The Chapel is part of the Folkestone circuit and the present Minister is Rev.Tom Allen B.D.who lives in Hythe. Officers of the Chapel include Mr.& Mrs.Shorter,she being the organist. Services are well attended and the Chapel is thriving.
